title: Hockney paints the stage (Art Theatre Paintings Ebook).pdf
description:
Pdf / English / 1983 / 227 pages / 16.2 MB

The sense of exuberant delight which has made David Hockney's paintings, drawings, prints and photographs among the most appealing and widely popular works of art today also permeates his work for the theatre. He had always been interested in theatricality and the stage as a device in his work as an artist, but when he actually turned his attention to the stage the result was astonishingly fresh and funny. And as Newsweek has put it, 'Perhaps more than anyone else, Hockney has put painting back onstage'. Bookseller Inventory
